intro: Lasthenia glabrata subsp. coulteri, commonly known as Coulter's stickyseed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments, exhibiting drought tolerance. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, and it produces small, sticky seeds that aid in seed dispersal. The subspecies is distinguished by its reduced leaf hairs and specific geographic distribution.
